Transforming animal farming through artificial intelligence

Global meat protein consumption is projected to increase by 3% by 2033, leading to higher greenhouse gas emissions. Artificial intelligence can revolutionise the livestock sector by increasing productivity while reducing environmental impact. AI-powered systems monitor animal health and behaviour, enabling early disease detection and personalized care. Precision livestock farming uses sensors, cameras, and machine learning algorithms to facilitate data-driven decision-making and optimized production methods.

Key Concepts:

  • transforming animal farming
  • increasing productivity while reducing emissions
  • personalized care
  • data-driven decision making
  • sustainable and efficient farming system
  • Abnormal behaviour in animals
  • Early detection of animal discomfort
  • Environmental monitoring and optimization
artificial intelligence internet of things livestock sector productivity environmental impact animal health machine learning precision livestock farming animal welfare data analytics
